p: In adult animals FMD does not produce high mortality, but it results in weight loss, decrease in milk production, loss of draught power, as well as infertility and abortion in dams. In young animals, however, FMD mortality can be high and FMDV can affect heart function ( Brooksby, 1982). FMD outbreaks in disease-free countries and regions can cause losses of more than US$1.5 billion per year ( Knight-Jones & Rushton, 2013; Leforban, 1999). As a result, FMD affected areas are subject to trade embargoes and cannot export animals or animal products to FMD-free countries.
